member.name: T:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService
member.summary: Windows Update Server implementation. Provides updates to Windows PCs

example.para: Attach this service to your ASP.NET service using SoapCore:

member.name: F:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.MetadataSource
member.summary: The local repository from where updates are served.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.MetadataSourceIndex
member.summary: Mapping of update index to its identity Update indexes are used when communicating with clients, as they are smaller that full Identities

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.#ctor(Microsoft.UpdateServices.Storage.IMetadataSource,Microsoft.UpdateServices.WebServices.ClientSync.Config,System.String)
member.summary: Instantiates a Windows Update server instance.
member.param: The source for updates metadata
Update service configuration. Sent to clients when requested with GetConfig and GetConfig2
The content root to use when setting the download URL in updates metadata

member.summary: Handle get configuration requests from clients
member.param: The client configuration as received from a Windows client
member.returns: The server configuration to be sent to a Windows client

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.GetConfigAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Handle get configuration requests from clients
member.param: The version of the Windows client connecting to this server
member.returns: The server configuration to be sent to a Windows client

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.SyncUpdatesAsync(Microsoft.UpdateServices.WebServices.ClientSync.Cookie,Microsoft.UpdateServices.WebServices.ClientSync.SyncUpdateParameters)
member.summary: Handle requests to sync updates. A client presents the list of installed updates and detectoids and the server replies with a list of more applicable updates, if any.
member.param: Access cookie
Request parameters: list of installed updates, list of known updates, etc.
member.returns: SyncInfo containing updates applicable to the caller.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.GetInstalledNotLeafGuidsFromSyncParameters(Microsoft.UpdateServices.WebServices.ClientSync.SyncUpdateParameters)
member.summary: Extract installed non-leaf updates from the response and maps them to a GUID
member.param: Sync parameters

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.GetOtherCachedUpdateGuidsFromSyncParameters(Microsoft.UpdateServices.WebServices.ClientSync.SyncUpdateParameters)
member.summary: Extract list of other known updates from the client and maps them to a GUID
member.param: Sync parameters

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.CreateUpdateInfoListFromSoftwareUpdate(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.UpdateServices.Metadata.SoftwareUpdate})
member.summary: Creates a list of updates to be sent to the client, based on the specified list of software updates. The update information sent to the client contains a deployment field and a core XML fragment extracted from the full metadata of the update
member.param: List of software updates to send to the client
member.returns: List of updates that can be appended to a SyncUpdates SOAP response to a client

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncWebService.CreateUpdateInfoListFromNonLeafUpdates(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.UpdateServices.Metadata.Update})
member.summary: Creates a list of updates to be sent to the client, based on the specified list of category updates. The update information sent to the client contains a deployment field and a core XML fragment extracted from the full metadata of the update
member.param: List of non-software updates to send to the client. These are usually detectoids, categories and classifications
member.returns: List of updates that can be appended to a SyncUpdates SOAP response to a client

member.name: T:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncContentController
member.summary: MVC controller for handling update content requests from Windows clients

example.para: Attach this service to your ASP.NET service:

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ClientSyncContentController.#ctor(Microsoft.UpdateServices.Storage.IMetadataSource,Microsoft.UpdateServices.Storage.IUpdateContentSource)
member.summary: Create a content controller from the specified metadata and update content sources.
member.param: The source of update metadata. Used to build the list of known files to serve.
The source of content. Used to read update content and send it to clients.

member.summary: Handle HTTP GET requests on the Content/(Directory)/(FileHash) URLs
member.param: The directory name for an update file
The file name for an update file
member.returns: File content on success, other error codes otherwise

member.summary: Handle HTTP HEAD requests on the Content/(Directory)/(FileName) URLs

The file name for an update file
member.returns: File header on success, other error codes otherwise

member.name: T:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.ISimpleAuthenticationWebService
member.summary: Declare an interface for the SimpleAuthSoap (WCF) service that can be used in AspNetCore with slight modifications. GetAuthorizationCookieAsync returns AuthorizationCookie instead of the nested GetAuthorizationCookieResult\GetAuthorizationResultBody

member.name: T:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.SimpleAuthenticationWebService
member.summary: Authentication service implementation. Reference implementation: all requests are authenticated and a token issued.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.SimpleAuthenticationWebService.GetAuthorizationCookieAsync(Microsoft.UpdateServices.WebServices.ClientAuthentication.GetAuthorizationCookieRequest)
member.summary: Handle requests for a authorization token. This implementation issues tokens for all requests without performing any checks.
member.param: The request paramerets. Not used in this implementation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.UpdateServerStartup
member.summary:
Startup class for a ASP.NET Core web service that implements the Client-Server sync protocol.
A web service started with UpdateServerStartup acts as an update server to Windows PCs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.UpdateServerStartup.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of UpdateServerStartup.

item.description: Required: string entry "metadata-source" with the path to file containing updates metadata.
Required: string entry "server-config" containing the server configuration in JSON format. A reference server configuration file is provided.
Optional: string entry "content-source" containing the path where update content is stored.

Optional: string entry "content-http-root" with the root URL where update content is serverd from (e.g. http://my-update-server.com). Usually this set to the address/name of the server. Required if "content-source" is specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.UpdateServerStartup.ConfigureServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary: Called by ASP.NET to configure services
member.param:
Service collection.
The client-server sync and simple authentication services are added to this list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.Server.UpdateServerStartup.Configure(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory)
member.summary: Called by ASP.NET to configure a web app's application pipeline
member.param:
Applicatin to configure.
A SOAP endpoint is configured for this app.
Hosting environment.
Logging factory.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.DataModel.UpdateXmlTransformer
member.summary: Convert the update XML into various fragments to be sent to clients. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-wusp/7b42ccc2-770b-4452-a0f8-e731474ad619

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.DataModel.UpdateXmlTransformer.GetCoreFragmentFromMetadataXml(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a core XML fragment from full update metadata XML. See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-wusp/7b42ccc2-770b-4452-a0f8-e731474ad619
member.param: Complete update XML

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.DataModel.UpdateXmlTransformer.GetExtendedFragmentFromMetadataXml(System.String)
member.summary: Get an extended fragment from full update metadata See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-wusp/7b42ccc2-770b-4452-a0f8-e731474ad619
member.param: Update metadata XML

member.name: M:Microsoft.UpdateServices.ClientSync.DataModel.UpdateXmlTransformer.GetLocalizedPropertiesFromMetadataXml(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Gets localized properties fragment from full update metadata
member.param: Update metadata XML
Language to get the localized properties for
